node.title: Victorian child tests positive for COVID-19 after arriving in SA
node.description: South Australia has recorded its first official COVID-19 case since yesterday's opening of borders to Victoria, NSW and the ACT.
node.content:
["South Australia has recorded its first official COVID-19 case since yesterday's opening of borders to Victoria, NSW and the ACT.", "The case \u2013 a young girl from Victoria \u2014 travelled into the state by road with her family yesterday to visit relatives.", "While travelling, the girl's family received a text message from Victorian authorities to say she was the close contact of a positive case in that state.", "The girl was tested at Tailem Bend and returned a positive result indicating she was in the early stage of infection.", "The girl and her family have now returned interstate to their home near the Victorian border to quarantine, while her two grandparents in SA will be required to undertake seven days of home quarantine.", "", "
COVID-19 testing in Tailem Bend after truck driver cases appeared their over winter.(ABC News: Lincoln Rothall)
", "Chief Public Health Officer Nicola Spurrier said the family only stopped once in South Australia, to use a public toilet, but it was not being considered an exposure site.", "\"Our system has worked \u2014 it's been picked up very early thank you to this mother \u2014 and the appropriate quarantine has now been put in place,\" Professor Spurrier said.", "Earlier today, authorities revealed another person had tested positive to COVID-19, but was not believed to be infectious.\u00a0", "The Victorian man had returned a positive COVID-19 test\u00a0after arriving in South Australia yesterday.", "He had COVID-19 about a month ago and tested positive yesterday.", "The infection had already been counted in Victoria's figures.", "Vaccinated residents of all Australian states were allowed to return to South Australia from yesterday \u2014 for the first time in months.", "Nearly 7,000 COVID-19 tests were conducted in South Australia yesterday, about 50 per cent more than normal.", "Seventy-nine per cent of the population aged 15 or over has now been fully vaccinated.", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
